marketNews.title: Snapshot of Today's News Compilation
marketNews.content: Snapshot of news compilation for today. The IHSG decreased by -0.28%.

marketNews.title: Temu Rumors and Unclear Government Stance on E-commerce Penetration
marketNews.content: The BUKA stock itself has been actively traded in recent days and even increased by +25% on Monday (7/10) following rumors that Temu - an e-commerce platform from China - intends to enter Indonesia by acquiring BUKA. On the other hand, the government seems not to be in agreement in responding to the issue of Temu entering Indonesia. The Minister of Communication and Informatics, Budi Arie Setiadi, said that his side forbids Temu from operating in Indonesia to protect domestic MSMEs. Meanwhile, the Director General of Domestic Trade at the Ministry of Trade, Moga Simatupang, stated that the operation of Temu in Indonesia is unavoidable. Moga mentioned that Temu has the opportunity to operate in Indonesia as long as it meets the requirements of Minister of Trade Regulation No. 31/2023. BUKA will hold an EGM shortly, with one of the agendas being to discuss the resignation plan of the company's Director and President, Teddy Nuryanto Oetomo. Key Takeaway: We assess that the movement of BUKA stock price will be more influenced by the development of potential or proposed corporate actions, considering the company's performance and outlook are still not very good. In 2Q24, BUKA again recorded a negative adjusted EBITDA of minus 41 billion rupiah, after having recorded a positive adjusted EBITDA for the first time of 15 billion rupiah in 1Q24. This performance decline caused BUKA management to cancel the guidance set at the beginning of 2024, which targeted a minimum FY24 adjusted EBITDA of 200 billion rupiah. On Thursday (10/10), BUKA's stock price fell -7.19% to 129 rupiah per share.

marketNews.title: Prabowo's Economic Growth Target and Investment Focus
marketNews.content: The elected President, Prabowo Subianto, is optimistic that Indonesia's economic growth can reach +9%, higher than the target he set at +8%. Prabowo admitted that the economic growth target set by him is often ridiculed, but he set this ambitious target so that the realization would not be far off if it failed to materialize. According to the Minister of Investment, Rosan Roeslani, investment and exports will be Indonesia's pillars to achieve an economic growth of +8%.

marketNews.title: Kominfo Closes Temu Access and Apple's TKDN Commitment
marketNews.content: The Minister of Communication and Informatics, Budi Arie Setiadi, said that his party has closed Temu's e-commerce access to Indonesia and has submitted an official letter to Google and Apple to remove the application from Indonesia. This step was taken because the China-based e-commerce platform is not registered as an electronic system operator in Indonesia. Budi stated that Temu's business model could destroy Indonesian MSMEs because the e-commerce platform sells goods directly from the factory to the consumer, thus potentially disrupting domestic products and labor. The Minister of Industry, Agus Gumiwang Kartasasmita, said that the iPhone 16 series cannot be officially sold in Indonesia because the validity period for Apple's Domestic Component Level (TKDN) certificate has expired. Agus mentioned that the process for extending the TKDN certificate is currently awaiting Apple to fulfill its investment commitment in Indonesia. Previously, Apple committed to investing 1.71 trillion rupiah in Indonesia, but the realization to date has only reached 1.48 trillion rupiah.

marketNews.title: Coal Entrepreneurs to Invest in IKN and Oil and Gas Well License Revocation
marketNews.content: The Minister of Public Works and Housing and Head of the IKN Authority, Basuki Hadimuljono, said that 16 coal entrepreneurs will invest in IKN, focusing on the retail and entertainment sectors such as building cinemas. Previously, President Joko Widodo received a number of mining companies that plan to invest in IKN in an internal meeting at the Presidential Palace, Jakarta. Some of the mining company representatives present included the President Director of Adaro Energy Indonesia (ADRO) Garibaldi Thohir, the President Director of Bumi Resources (BUMI) Adika Nuraga Bakrie, the Vice President Director of Indika Energy (INDY) Aziz Armand, and officials from the Indonesian Coal Mining Association (APBI) Adri Martowardojo. The Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, said that his side will revoke the business licenses of oil and gas wells that are inactive or idle. Bahlil mentioned that as many as 5,000 out of 16,000 idle wells have significant reserve potential, with most concessions held by State-Owned Enterprises (BUMN) and Pertamina. Later, the revoked licenses will be offered to other companies to increase national oil and gas lifting.

marketNews.title: Foreign Funds Leaving Asian Markets Excluding China in October
marketNews.content: Foreign funds were recorded leaving Asian stock markets excluding China in October 2024, driven by profit-taking amid concerns over valuations and escalation of conflict in the Middle East. Based on LSEG data since the beginning of October 2024, foreign funds have recorded a net sell of 7.61 billion US dollars in the stock markets of India, Indonesia, Thailand, Vietnam, South Korea, Taiwan, and the Philippines. Previously, foreign funds posted a net buy of 759 million US dollars in September 2024 due to optimism about aggressive interest rate cuts from the Fed.

marketNews.title: Inalum IPO Postponed Pending New Smelter Investor and SGAR Phase 2 Preparation
marketNews.content: Deputy Minister of State-Owned Enterprises, Kartika Wirjoatmodjo, said that the IPO plan for PT Indonesia Asahan Aluminium (Inalum) and MIND ID will only be carried out in 2026-2027 after the entry of a new investor for the smelter expansion project in Kuala Tanjung, North Sumatra. Kartika said that his side has shortlisted 2 strategic investor candidates who will become Inalum's partners in the smelter expansion project. In addition, Kartika also mentioned that his side is currently preparing the final investment decision (FID) documents for the construction of the smelter grade alumina refinery (SGAR) phase 2 in Mempawah Regency, West Kalimantan. Documents related to the investment for both projects are targeted to be completed by the end of 2024.

marketNews.title: PBoC Launches Liquidity Facility for Stock Investors
marketNews.content: The central bank of China (PBoC) released a swap facility worth 500 billion yuan (~70.6 billion US dollars) to provide liquidity for institutional investors to buy stocks. This facility, effective as of Thursday (10/10), is part of the stimulus package announced by PBoC Governor, Pan Gongsheng, at the end of September 2024.

tickerNews.title: EMTK Acquires BUKA Shares worth ~Rp1.2 Trillion
tickerNews.content: The controller of BUKA, Elang Mahkota Teknologi ($EMTK), became one of the buyers in the jumbo transaction of Bukalapak ($BUKA) shares yesterday. EMTK bought 9.83 billion (9.54%) BUKA shares at a price of 120 rupiah per share, totaling 1.18 trillion rupiah. After this transaction, EMTK's ownership in BUKA increased from 0.82% to 10.36%. In addition to direct ownership, EMTK owns 24.62% of BUKA shares through its subsidiary, PT Kreatif Media Karya. The buyer for the remaining 3.67 billion shares worth 920 billion rupiah in yesterday's transaction is not yet known. The selling party has also not been confirmed, but the number of shares sold is equivalent to the ownership stake of API (Hong Kong) Investment Limited - an investment company owned by Ant Financial (Alibaba) - in BUKA. BUKA's stock itself has been actively traded in recent days and even rose +25% on Monday (7/10) along with the emergence of rumors that Temu - an e-commerce platform from China - intends to enter Indonesia by acquiring BUKA.

tickerNews.title: AMMN to Allocate up to US$200 Million Annually in Capex for Batu Hijau Mine
tickerNews.content: AMMN: Vice President of Corporate Communications and Investor Relations Amman Mineral Internasional, Kartika Octaviana, stated that the company will allocate routine capital expenditure of approximately 150-200 million US dollars per year for the next 5 years to open the phase 8 pit at the company's Batu Hijau mine. Mining phase 8 at Batu Hijau is targeted to produce between 2025-2030, which can extend AMMN's mining life after phase 7 production ends at the end of 2024. Based on the JORC report as of 2023, phase 8 mining has total reserves of 3.86 billion pounds of copper and 5.3 million ounces of gold. Previously, Bloomberg reported in July 2024 that AMMN was seeking a loan of up to 1.5 billion US dollars to expand the Batu Hijau mine.

tickerNews.title: POWR Plans to Issue Debt of up to US$500 Million
tickerNews.content: POWR: Cikarang Listrindo plans to issue debt securities of up to 500 million US dollars with a fixed interest rate of a maximum of 7% per year and a maturity period of no later than 10 years. This corporate action is intended to increase liquidity, support general financing needs, and refinance debt maturing in 2026. This plan will be discussed at the EGM on November 22, 2024.

tickerNews.title: RAJA's Pipeline Project to Generate Rp225 Billion Annually in Revenue
tickerNews.content: RAJA: President Director of Rukun Raharja, Djauhar Maulidi, stated that the Tanjung Batu-Samarinda fuel pipeline project will generate revenue of 225 billion rupiah per year, with an EBITDA contribution of 200 billion per year. The project will be carried out by a consortium led by RAJA's subsidiary, PT Petrotech Penta Nusa, with the company investing according to its participation portion of approximately 982.5 billion rupiah to execute the contract. The construction period for the project will last for 2 years, with the operation and maintenance period lasting for 10 years from the commercial operation date.

tickerNews.title: SMRA Announces Capital Injection to Subsidiary, Increasing Paid-up Capital
tickerNews.content: SMRA: Summarecon Agung announced a capital injection of 485 billion rupiah to its subsidiary, PT Summarecon Property Development, causing the placed and paid-up capital of the company to increase from 4.56 trillion rupiah to 5.05 trillion rupiah. SMRA itself owns 99.99% of PT Summarecon Property Development shares. Besides receiving the increase in placed and paid-up capital, PT Summarecon Property Development also increased its authorized capital from 6 trillion rupiah to 7 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: LPCK Plans Rights Issue with Up to 52.82% Dilution for Working Capital
tickerNews.content: LPCK: Lippo Cikarang plans to conduct a rights issue of up to 3 billion new shares with a dilution effect of up to 52.82%. The ratio and exercise price have not been announced, while the funds obtained are intended for working capital and/or capital participation to subsidiaries. This plan will be discussed at the EGM on November 15, 2024.

tickerNews.title: VICI to Distribute Interim Dividend of Rp35 per Share for FY2024
tickerNews.content: VICI: Victoria Care Indonesia will distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 23.48 billion rupiah or 35 rupiah per share. The cum-dividend date in the regular and negotiated market is October 17, 2024, with payment on November 8, 2024. Referring to VICI's stock price on Thursday (10/10) at 640 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 5.46%.

tickerNews.title: BELI views Fintech as an Important Catalyst for Primary Growth, Continues Development
tickerNews.content: BELI: President Director of Global Digital Niaga, Kusumo Martanto, stated that the fintech business is an important catalyst and a driver of the company's primary business growth. Kusumo also mentioned that the company will continue developments in the fintech segment going forward. Nevertheless, Kusumo did not elaborate further on the developments that BELI will undertake in the fintech segment, and stated that his party does not yet see the segment as a main source of business revenue. BELI itself owns a 25% stake in the fintech company, Cermati Group, and has a strategic partnership with Blu or BCA Digital.
